content:
Complexes 1–6 were synthesized by solvothermal reactions. A mixture of La­(NO3)3·​6H2O (0.25 mmol, 82 mg), H4L ligand (0.25 mmol, 112 mg), DMAC (3.5 mL), and water (1.5 mL) was added to a Teflon-lined autoclave at 100 °C for 2 days and then cooled to room temperature gradually. The resulting brown crystal was filtrated, and washed with DMAC for several times. The yield was 57, 55, 61, 49, 54, and 68% for 1–6 (based on H4L), respectively.

[La<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<italic> <sub>n</sub> </italic>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>1</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24­LaN2O9 (671.4), C 50.09, H 3.60, N 4.17; found: C 50.01, H 3.55, N 4.13. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3471 (w), 3065 (w), 1647 (s), 1596 (s), 1393 (s), 1167 (w), 768 (m), 709 (w), 593 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Pr<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<italic> <sub>n</sub> </italic>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>2</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24­PrN2O9 (673.4), C 49.94, H 3.59, N 4.16; found: C 49.91, H 3.51, N 4.08. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3486 (w), 2933 (w), 1640 (s), 1589 (s), 1392 (s), 1021 (w), 768 (m), 716 (w), 593 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 218 nm.

[Nd<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>3</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24­NdN2O9 (676.73), C 49.69, H 3.57, N 4.14; found: C 49.81, H 3.48, N 4.05. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3479 (w), 2933 (w), 1639 (s), 1596 (s), 1378 (s), 1007 (w), 768 (m), 702 (w), 585 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Sm<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<italic> <sub>n</sub> </italic>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>4</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48­Sm2N4O23 (1445.7), C 49.25, H 3.54, N 4.10; found: C 49.01, H 3.44, N 4.01. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3470 (w), 2960 (w), 1627 (s), 1580 (s), 1369 (s), 1047 (w), 760 (m), 711 (w), 590 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Eu<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>5</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48­Eu2N4O19 (1384.92), C 49.13, H 3.53, N 4.09; found: C 48.90, H 3.41, N 3.98. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3469 (w), 2947 (w), 1617 (s), 1579 (s), 1388 (s), 1089 (w), 757 (m), 706 (w), 579 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Gd<sub>2</sub>(L)<sub>2</sub>(DMA)<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>·<italic>n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>6</bold>)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48­Gd2N4O23 (1459.48), C 48.76, H 3.51, N 4.06; found: C 48.27, H 3.39, N 3.97. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3480 (w), 2921 (w), 1657 (s), 1569 (s), 1374 (s), 1034 (w), 764 (m), 703 (w), 585 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

Complexes 7 and 8 were synthesized by a room temperature reaction. A mixture of the corresponding lanthanide nitrate (0.3 mmol), H4L (0.3 mmol), DMAC (4 mL), and H2O (1.5 mL) was added to a round-bottom flask with a magneton, and stirred at room temperature for 24 h. The resulting white powder was filtrated, and washed with DMAC for several times. The yield was 72% and 65% for 7 and 8 (based on H4L), respectively. For the isostructure complexes 9 and 10, the synthetic methods are the same as the above-mentioned except using a lanthanide nitrate mixture as the starting materials in stoichiometric ratios. The yield was 61% and 67% for 9 and 10 (based on H4L), respectively. The identical structures of complexes 1–10 are demonstrated by the corresponding PXRD patterns (Figure S4).
clean_text:
Synthesis of Complexes 1-10 

Complexes 1-6 were synthesized by solvothermal reactions. A mixture of La(NO3)3⋅6H2O (0.25 mmol, 82 mg), H4L ligand (0.25 mmol, 112 mg), DMAC (3.5 mL), and water (1.5 mL) was added to a Teflon-lined autoclave at 100 °C for 2 days and then cooled to room temperature gradually. The resulting brown crystal was filtrated, and washed with DMAC for several times. The yield was 57, 55, 61, 49, 54, and 68% for 1-6 (based on H4L), respectively.

[La2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (1)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24LaN2O9 (671.4), C 50.09, H 3.60, N 4.17; found: C 50.01, H 3.55, N 4.13. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3471 (w), 3065 (w), 1647 (s), 1596 (s), 1393 (s), 1167 (w), 768 (m), 709 (w), 593 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Pr2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (2)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24PrN2O9 (673.4), C 49.94, H 3.59, N 4.16; found: C 49.91, H 3.51, N 4.08. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3486 (w), 2933 (w), 1640 (s), 1589 (s), 1392 (s), 1021 (w), 768 (m), 716 (w), 593 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 218 nm.

[Nd2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (3)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C28H24NdN2O9 (676.73), C 49.69, H 3.57, N 4.14; found: C 49.81, H 3.48, N 4.05. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3479 (w), 2933 (w), 1639 (s), 1596 (s), 1378 (s), 1007 (w), 768 (m), 702 (w), 585 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Sm2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (4)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48Sm2N4O23 (1445.7), C 49.25, H 3.54, N 4.10; found: C 49.01, H 3.44, N 4.01. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3470 (w), 2960 (w), 1627 (s), 1580 (s), 1369 (s), 1047 (w), 760 (m), 711 (w), 590 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Eu2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (5)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48Eu2N4O19 (1384.92), C 49.13, H 3.53, N 4.09; found: C 48.90, H 3.41, N 3.98. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3469 (w), 2947 (w), 1617 (s), 1579 (s), 1388 (s), 1089 (w), 757 (m), 706 (w), 579 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

[Gd2(L)2(DMA)2] n ⋅nH2O (6)

Elemental analysis (%): Calcd for C56H48Gd2N4O23 (1459.48), C 48.76, H 3.51, N 4.06; found: C 48.27, H 3.39, N 3.97. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3480 (w), 2921 (w), 1657 (s), 1569 (s), 1374 (s), 1034 (w), 764 (m), 703 (w), 585 (w). UV/vis [DMAC, λ]: 217 nm.

Complexes 7 and 8 were synthesized by a room temperature reaction. A mixture of the corresponding lanthanide nitrate (0.3 mmol), H4L (0.3 mmol), DMAC (4 mL), and H2O (1.5 mL) was added to a round-bottom flask with a magneton, and stirred at room temperature for 24 h. The resulting white powder was filtrated, and washed with DMAC for several times. The yield was 72% and 65% for 7 and 8 (based on H4L), respectively. For the isostructure complexes 9 and 10, the synthetic methods are the same as the above-mentioned except using a lanthanide nitrate mixture as the starting materials in stoichiometric ratios. The yield was 61% and 67% for 9 and 10 (based on H4L), respectively. The identical structures of complexes 1-10 are demonstrated by the corresponding PXRD patterns (Figure S4).
